channel.title: VirtualBox
channel.description:
I'm sure lots of you already know about it, but for those who don't, it's a multi-platform virtual machine that you can install just about any operating system onto, and run it inside another OS.
[url=http://virtualbox.org]virtualbox.org[/url]
(It's free, too.)
Anyway, here's Xubuntu running on VirtualBox on Vista:
[img]http://img392.imageshack.us/img392/3936/vboxsk7.png[/img]

item.title: VirtualBox
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“wow_raped XD, post:10, topic:210915”][quote author=magma828 link=topic=277854.msg2312458#msg2312458 date=1215118312]
Is this better than Microsoft’s VM? I had that but it was really slow and also said my operating system is not fully supported.
[/quote]
Of course this is better. Its not made by Microsoft.[/quote]

That’s a very wrong attitude. I’m sure you’re using windows aren’t you? So don’t make little jokes like that.

Read full topic

item.title: VirtualBox
item.dc:creator: @wow_raped_XD wow_raped XD
item.description:
@wow_raped_XD wrote:

On another topic

Is this better than Microsoft’s VM? I had that but it was really slow and also said my operating system is not fully supported.

Of course this is better. Its not made by Microsoft.

Read full topic

item.title: VirtualBox
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

I’ve had it for a bit now, I like it a lot more than VMWare or whatever is it.

Picture of XP running inside ArchLinux =P

Read full topic

item.title: VirtualBox
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

Hmm, been using this for ages, it’s nice, but there’s also other good alternatives, this is probably the best to host linux and to use a linux host…

Read full topic

item.title: VirtualBox
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Running an OS in another OS is a plus for many reasons. You can test applications that might possibly harm your system. You can use it to develop for cross-platform use, etc. It is helpful, I use it quite often.

Read full topic

item.title: VirtualBox
item.dc:creator: @Larenzo Larenzo
item.description:
@Larenzo wrote:

[quote=“VB7 Rocks, post:5, topic:210915”][quote author=Doggie3342 link=topic=277854.msg2267286#msg2267286 date=1213060732]
so you dont have to buy the second os? so you can try out an os before buying it? im sure there are other reasons, but im dling this as we speak, looks awesome
[/quote]

It doesn’t include operating systems, and yes, you’d have to have a copy of the OS you want to install on it.

But then again, Linux doesn’t cost anything, does it? ;)[/quote]
Agreed, Linux , as everyone knows you can order 5 and give them out l0l, so no point in turning your windows xp into Ubuntu Etc

Read full topic
